references.paper_title: Column-randomized linear programs: Performance guarantees and applications
references.reason: This paper proposes a column-randomized method for reducing the dimensionality of LPs, which is a direct comparison to the data-driven projection method proposed in the main paper.
This paper provides a foundational framework for data-driven algorithm design, which is heavily utilized for the generalization bound analysis in the main paper.

references.paper_title: Generalization bounds for data-driven numerical linear algebra
references.reason: This paper offers relevant generalization bounds for data-driven numerical linear algebra, which is directly applicable to the theoretical analysis of the data-driven projection method in the main paper.
This paper introduces the random projection method for reducing the size of LPs, which serves as a baseline method and a comparison to the proposed data-driven method.
This paper discusses the statistical learning setting for LPs, which is closely related to the data-driven learning formulation and the generalization bound analysis in the main paper.
